author: Debra Heine
title: O'Keefe Sting Disrupts #DisruptJ20's Plans
text:
In part 1 of a new undercover video series, James O’Keefe’s Project Veritas catches left-wing activists allegedly planning to use stink bombs to disrupt an event scheduled this week for Donald Trump’s inauguration as the 45th president of the United States.
Via Breitbart:
The leftists captured on film were allegedly targeting the Deploraball, a grass-roots event being held on Thursday at the National Press Club “to celebrate and honor … the passionate citizens who worked social media, knocked on doors, and endured harassment to support” Trump during the 2016 presidential campaign.
On Friday, several news outlets reported that a group of left-wing activists from the “D.C. Anti-Fascist Coalition,” part of a broader effort called “#DisruptJ20” (for January 20th, the date of the inauguration) had been captured on tape discussing plans to crash the Deplorable, disrupt the parade at the inauguration, and target specific individuals.
As PJ Media reported last week, #DisruptJ20 has been quite open about its goal of preventing the peaceful transfer of power.
The new Project Veritas video shows exactly what types of nasty disruptions the #DisruptJ20 activists had in mind. In part 1, we see them allegedly planning to set off butyric acid “stink bomb” devices at the party. As a backup plan, they also speak about triggering the fire sprinkler system, forcing attendees to evacuate outside into the cold.
Luke Kuhn, of the D.C. Anti-Fascist Coalition, is heard on the video actually threatening the city government of Washington, D.C., and the police if they try to stop them:
"The message has to be, we do not recognize the city government either," Kuhn says. "If you try to close us down we will look for your house, we will burn it. We will physically fight the police if they try to steal one of our places. We will go to war and you will lose."
The group's spokeswoman put out a memo to its members after they discovered they had been infiltrated.
Half your team has been compromised, @lacymacauley . Too little too late! Kick the tires and light the fires. pic.twitter.com/dJUs9X40Mm
— James O'Keefe (@JamesOKeefeIII) January 16, 2017
But it was too late.
#ThatMomentWhen you think you're about to get away with criminal acts. @lukefromdc @SmashRacismDC @lacymacauley #veritasiseverywhere #tcot pic.twitter.com/DquNIzewt5
— Project Veritas (@Project_Veritas) January 16, 2017
During the campaign, Project Veritas had been very effective at exposing how the organized left had worked with the Clinton campaign and the Democratic National Committee to stage protests and to incite violence at Donald Trump’s events using a practice known as "bird-dogging." The goal was to create a sense of anarchy surrounding the candidate and it was working until O'Keefe exposed their dark agenda.
Now, O’Keefe has apparently revealed further plans to create anarchy and disorder around Trump’s inauguration. And, as he points out in the video, the actions planned by the activists could run afoul of anti-terrorism laws.
O’Keefe and Project Veritas say that they shared the results of their investigation with the FBI, the Secret Service, and the D.C. Metro Police.
